text: Bottle, served hot @ Niso Sushi in Sønderborg. Clear with no head. Mild herbal aroma with tea, some fruit and mild rice, some warming alcohol. Smooth and balanced flavor, herbal tea, fruits, rice and alcohol. Balanced body, nice aftertaste with fruit, yeast and alcohol. Nice, pretty straight forward, no off flavors, all in all pretty nice.
Bottle from umashi in Odense. Clear body with no head. Spicy, floral, light alcohol, notes of wine.
At SUMO restaurant. Nice surprise, quite spicy this one, perfect with sushi meal. (Arnhem 201609)

180ml bottle. Clear pale yellow colour, no head and aroma of rice, alcohol, melon. Taste is sweetish, rice, grassy, some booze and caramel notes. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, dry warming finish. Quite drinkable.

180 ml pull-tab bottle with pull-tab bought at Esso Tiger Mart in Transport Plaza, Yuen Long.
[Preparation: Bottle stored, opened and served at room temperature (10°C) as suggested on the label.]
Clear, near colourless with very pale yellowish hue; Fragrant aroma of rice wine, with boiled glutinous rice, strong pollen, strong floral, pear ester, strong alcohol and strong sugar; Medium sweet taste of rich rice spirit, with strong tartness, very strong warming alcohol, pears flesh, bitter melon, sugar, liquorices and strong tannin; Close to light body. Thick and oily palate; Mouth feel is fairly dry and strong rice wine. The 5% blend of Ginjo Koshu contributes much of its fiery characters  very oily feel and bombastic warming alcohol, yet not razor sharp and quite easy to embrace. The honjozo itself is very tart, sugary with fairly good esters. Strong astringency from liquorices and tannin with bitter melon taste. Good!... Fairly dry after taste; Warming and strong sweet-bitter to mouth.

Comments: The Koshu factor really drive this one to a different level, with tasty hard-hitting booze and hard sweetness mixed well with strong tartness and dryness. Woul have been mistaken as a straight Genshu, this fusion sake wirks out just fine - in small amount. A yes!

How: Bottle.
Where: From an asian store in Copenhagen.
Appearance: Clear colour, no head.
Aroma: Rice, some fruit.
Body: Light body, no carbonation.
Flavour: Rice, alcohol, some fruit.
Bottled. A white sake. The aroma has notes of rice. The flavor is sweet with notes of rice and alcohol, leading to a dry finish.
18 cl bottle. Pours clear and with no head. Aroma is mild rice and slight fruity. Toasted rice, mild fruity. Clean and crisp rice base. Short finish.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Simple, clear and classy one with some pepper in the back and a really small sourness in the middle. Straight forward sake with also some pineapple in the aroma. Nice one.

Pours out of the bottle in a very light vanilla-clear water colour with medium body. Aroma of rice and bamboo. Taste of yasemine rice, flowers, dust, bamboo and light vanilla. Hints of roses. Very nice Sake.

Bottle 180ml.Clear cristal water colour with no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, fruity, alcohol notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long to average duration, rice,alcohol, sharp, fruity. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20131012]
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear as water without head. Aroma is sweet, rice, some alcohol and minor notes of fruit. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 121013
Sake cup. Clear as water with no head. Aroma is rice, almond and a fruit. Flavour is rice, almind, medium sweet, fruit, wood with notes of alcohol.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is water. Aroma and taste are rice malt, alcohol and a little sugar. Notes of almonds as well.

This bottled Sake from rbsg #55 poured a very small sized head of clear colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a and a oily lacing. The aroma was alcohol. . The flavor contained notes of vinous and alcohol. An OK sake typical and nothing special.
Bottle at the Grand Tasting during RBSG courtesy of KyotoLefty.  Pours a clear, looking like water.  Warm and light banana.  Thin and warm, lightly sweet.  Light banana.  Grows warm on the finish.
Pours clear as water. The aroma is boozy with some mineral, some rice, and some fruitiness. The flavor is fruity and somewhat sweet with a raw grain kind of character.

180 ml bottle. 
Fruity, caramel, milk, aroma, sweetish, a bit of oxidation from the koshu. Much more aging in the flavor, sweet, caramel and sherry. Funky too. Fruity, with raisins, milky. The taste is dominated by the koshu, though not overwhelming and with a regular sake palate, though quite creamy. Funky and interesting. A good introduction to koshu without the weirdness. That little 15% really kicks the flavor in, though. Cheap and tasty.
